page.title: 02FARMING IN CHELFORD
page.content: This area is mainly agricultural and contains twenty-one farms. We were able to visit twelve of them. All except two of them were proper working farms. The oldest farm, Holly Tree Farm dated back to the sixteenth century, and Roadside,Fir-tree, Wyches and Peck Mill were over three hundred years old.The others were all at least three generations old. They varied in size quite a lot. The largest farm, Roadside Farm had 210 acres and the smallest, Wyches Farm had all the land sold except six acres and is now a private house. All except two families had lived at their farms for at least thirty years. Chandler's Farm has two cows for their own use, thirty beef cattle, 140 ewes, 220 lambs and 150 poultry. They grow hay for their animals.
